meanings.definition: Eloigns (verb): to remove to a distance; to withdraw.
meanings.sent1: She eloigns herself from the noisy crowd to find peace.
meanings.sent2: The teacher eloigns the distracting student from the classroom.
meanings.sent3: The cat eloigns from the playful puppy to take a nap.
meanings.sent4: The sun slowly eloigns behind the mountains, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The boat eloigns from the shore, sailing towards the horizon.

meanings.definition: Eloigns (noun): a removal to a distance.
meanings.sent1: The eloigns of the ship from the dock was a beautiful sight.
meanings.sent2: His eloigns from the city brought him closer to nature.
meanings.sent3: The eloigns of the clouds made the sky look vast and endless.
meanings.sent4: The eloigns of the music faded into the night, leaving a sense of tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The eloigns of the mountains in the distance was breathtaking.
